name: Super Mario 64
description: A 1996 platform game for the Nintendo 64 and the first Super Mario game to feature 3D gameplay.

name: The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time
description: A 1998 action-adventure game developed by Nintendo for the Nintendo 64, widely regarded as one of the greatest video games ever made.

name: Final Fantasy VII
description: A 1997 role-playing video game developed by Square for the PlayStation, often credited with popularizing the RPG genre outside of Japan.

name: Pokémon Red and Blue
description: The first installments of the Pokémon video game series, released in 1996 for the Game Boy, starting a global phenomenon.

name: GoldenEye 007
description: A 1997 first-person shooter developed by Rare for the Nintendo 64, based on the 1995 James Bond film GoldenEye.

name: Halo: Combat Evolved
description: A 2001 first-person shooter developed by Bungie and published by Microsoft Game Studios for the Xbox, launching one of the most successful gaming franchises.

name: Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas
description: A 2004 action-adventure game developed by Rockstar North and published by Rockstar Games, known for its open-world gameplay and cultural impact.

name: World of Warcraft
description: A massively multiplayer online role-playing game released by Blizzard Entertainment in 2004, becoming one of the most popular MMORPGs of all time.

name: Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 2
description: A 2000 skateboarding video game developed by Neversoft and published by Activision, known for its gameplay, soundtrack, and cultural influence.

name: Metal Gear Solid
description: A 1998 stealth game developed by Konami for the PlayStation, known for its cinematic experience and complex narrative.
